column1: #Text=The only reason I can think of is that the Japanese atoll is kind of middle-of-nowhere in the western Pacific, while the Spratly Islands are smack in the middle of the busiest sea-lanes in the region, with about five competing territorial claims....
#Text=If nothing else, your reference also got me to read about Rockall, where the UK foregoes any claim to an economic exclusion zone.
#Text=Seems like this could be a useful example for others....
